description: Installation of LCD Screen showing illuminated static and animated displays (Advertisement Consent)
decision_conditions: 1.  The consent shall expire after 5 years from the date of this notice.

2.  Any advertisements displayed, and any site used for the display of advertisements, shall be maintained in a clean and tidy condition to the reasonable satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority.
3.  Any structure or hoarding erected or used principally for the purpose of displaying advertisements shall be maintained in a safe condition.
4.  Where an advertisement is required under these Regulations to be removed, the removal shall be carried out to the reasonable satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority.
5.  No advertisement is to be displayed without the permission of the owner of the site or any other person with an interest in the site entitled to grant permission.

6.  No advertisement shall be sited or displayed so as to obscure, or hinder the ready interpretation of, any road traffic sign, railway signal or aid to navigation by water or air, or so as otherwise to render hazardous the use of any highway, waterway (including any coastal waters) or aerodrome (civil or military).

Note: These are imposed automatically unless expressly varied, for instance the time limit shortened. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved drawings and plans: Appendix A Hub Unit Specification, Appendix B Community Channel, Appendix C sustainability, Appendix D Pavement Reinstatement, Community Heartbeat Trust, Communication Hub Unit Management Plan V4 June 2023, A02705 Site plan and images, covering letter prepared by JCDecaux dated 10 March 2025.

REASON: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | The maximum illumination of the sign(s)/advertisement(s) shall comply with the recommendations of the Institution of Lighting Professionals in their Professional Lighting Guide "PLG05 2023 "The Brightness of Illuminated Advertisements including Digital Displays", including the following operational features:
o	Pre-curfew (07:00-23:00): 300cd/m2 (up to 20m2) and 200cd/m2 (20m2 or more)
o	Post curfew (11:00pm-07:00am): display off or level reduced to 50% of pre-curfew level.
o	Daytime level: to be set according to Table 10.5 of PLG05 2023.
o	Static images to be displayed only (no moving or flashing images).
Changes between adverts to take place instantly with no sequencing, fading, swiping or merging of images.
o	Advertisements to change no more frequently than once every ten seconds.
o	Vertical illuminance of sensitive facades shall not exceed the recommendations for Environmental Zone 3 of the ILP 'Guidance Note 01/20 For The Reduction Of Obtrusive Light'

REASON: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by artificial lighting, in accordance with Policy D3, D4, T3 and T4 of the London Plan (2021) and Policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).
